column2: Franklin D. Roosevelt's paralytic illness began in 1921 at age 39, when he got a fever after exercising heavily during a vacation in Canada
during his terms as President of the United States, the extent of his paralysis was kept from public view
during his terms as President of the United State
the extent of his paralysis was kept from public view
Roosevelt was very rarely photographed while sitting in his wheelchair
Paralyzed from the waist down after suffering a bout of polio, Roosevelt
Paralyzed from the waist dow dep=V004001
By August 12, 1921, he could no longer stand.
Roosevelt even had his car adapted to his disability
At age 39, Roosevelt had lost the use of both of his legs.
lost the use of both of his leg
Roosevelt had steel leg braces created that could be locked into an upright position to keep his legs straight
Roosevelt found a health spa in 1924 that seemed to be one of the very few things that could ease his pain.

At this spa in Warm Springs, Georgia, Roosevelt subsequently built a house (known as "the Little White House") and established a polio treatment center to help other polio sufferers. http://history1900s.about.com/od/people/a/fdr.htm
Franklin Delano Roosevelt was 32nd president of United States, elected 4 times, 1932 - 1945
Roosevelt was a central figure to economic/ military / world order events 1930-1945
Roosevelt entered war and lead US to overwhelmingly win WW2
Roosevelt initiated New Deal - US recovery from Depression, with jobs, and manufacturing;  reforms on financial, transportation
Roosevelt agreed to develop Atomic Bombs
